law.catch_line: In this section, "human service facility" means a facility licensed by the State that is:...

text.section: A human service facility shall develop an emergency plan.

An emergency plan shall include procedures that will be followed before, during, and after an emergency to address:
the evacuation, transportation, or shelter-in-place of individuals served by the human service facility;
the notification to families, staff, and licensing authorities regarding the action that will be taken concerning the safety and well-being of the individuals served by the human service facility;
staff coverage, organization, and assignment of responsibilities; and
the continuity of operations, including:
procuring essential goods, equipment, and services; and
relocation to alternate facilities.

section.section:
This subsection does not prohibit a human service facility from applying for and receiving reimbursement:
under any applicable insurance policy; or
from any State or federal funds that may be available due to a declared State or federal emergency.

A human service facility is solely responsible for any financial obligation arising from voluntary or mandatory activation of any aspect of the emergency plan developed by the human service facility under this section.

On or before November 30, 2007, a State agency that is responsible for the licensing of a human service facility shall adopt regulations governing the development of emergency plans under this section.

text.section: For purposes of coordinating local emergency planning efforts, a human service facility shall provide access to the emergency plans developed under this section to local organizations for emergency management.
